data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Once you complete the first 5 steps, you are facing forward. If you repeat 5 steps for 10 minutes, you must complete one complete set of steps. If you repeat 5 steps for 9 minutes, you must complete 2 complete sets of steps. If you repeat 5 steps for 9 minutes, you must complete 2 complete sets of steps. So, the answer is No.

Take 4 steps to turn around to the left and go 4 steps to the right then turn around to the left. So, the answer is Yes.

If the person takes 6 steps and turns around, it still takes 6 steps to return to the starting point. So, the answer is yes.

If each step is repeated, you will always get back to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

If you follow the instructions, you should always face forward. The correct order of taking 3 steps forward is from the left to the right. If you follow the instructions, take 4 steps forward. The correct order of taking 6 steps forward is from the right to the left. So, the answer is No.

Take back 3 steps for the same amount of time you were there. Take back 2 steps for the same amount of time you were there. Take back 7 steps for the same amount of time you were there. Take back 3 steps for the same amount of time you were there. So, the answer is Yes.

One step backward takes you back into the starting point. Taking 1 step backward takes you one step forward. So, the answer is No.

Steps may not always be found in the same place. The first step is the first step to start the process. The next step is the next step to the starting point (second step). The next step to the starting point is the 4th step to its first step. So, the answer is Yes.

You don’t go back to the starting point in step 1. When you first arrive back at the starting point, you go 2 steps forward. When you first stray away to take 7 steps left (right), you go 7 steps left. When you return to face forward, take 9 steps forward. Thus, the answer is No.
